page.title: 08BRANSTON OLD HALL
page.content: Branston Old Hall was built in 1735 by Lord Vere Bertie. After the Enclosure Act of 1765 he was the largest landowner. His land stretched as far as the River Witham. As far as we know the Melville family were the last family to live in the Hall. Alexander Leslie Melville built the present Hall in 1885 and there was a fire there on Jan.1st 1903.Alexander lived in the Hall till his death in 1919.The Melville family lived in Branston from 1883 till 1922.In 1887 the Hon. A.L.Melville built a school on Hall Lane in which 70 children enrolled.Later it became an infant school. Lindsey County Council later bought the Hall and used it for a sanatorium. In 1983 Branston Hall became a retirement home.
